New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 12 games
Darius Garland scored a game-high 40 points and nine assists
Key Match Events: Toronto Raptors scored 42 points in the third quarter
Cleveland Cavaliers withstood fatigue to secure the win
Free-throw disparity (20-for-25 vs. 6-for-13) and offensive rebounding (16-9 in favour of Cleveland) were significant
Pre-Game Insights: Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic emphasized the importance of competing against top teams
Cleveland Cavaliers were riding a 16-game win streak
Toronto Raptors had several key absences due to injuries and assignments
Post-Match Reflections: Raptors head coach Darko Rajakovic praised the team's effort and competitiveness
Free-throw and rebounding discrepancies were highlighted as key factors in the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the latest meeting between Evan Mobley and Scottie Barnes, with Mobley averaging slightly better stats than Barnes in their head-to-head matchups
Cleveland Cavaliers' 12-game winning streak included a win over the Oklahoma City Thunder
Others: The game was the second leg of a back-to-back for both teams
Chris Boucher contributed significantly with 23 points and 12 rebounds
